name: Potato Chorizo Taquitos
description: Here's an easy recipe for some baked Potato Chorizo Taquitos.  I dipped this batch in some Chipotle Mayo -- yum!!
recipeIngredient: 1.5 lbs.  potatoes (I used 2 small Gold potatoes)

recipeInstructions.text: Give the potatoes a good rinse and finely cube them.  I usually leave the skin on.
recipeInstructions.name: Give the potatoes a good rinse and finely cube them.  I usually leave the skin on.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.  Add the cubed potatoes and cook for 5-10 minutes or until they are mostly cooked through.  I usually take them off and drain them once the outsides are cooked but the inside is still a little firm.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.  Add the cubed potatoes and cook for 5-10 minutes or until they are mostly cooked through.  I usually take them off and drain them once the outsides are cooked but the inside is still a little firm.

recipeInstructions.text: As the potatoes are cooking, add the chorizo to a skillet and brown it over medium heat, approx. 8-10 minutes.   Once browned set aside until you need it.
recipeInstructions.name: As the potatoes are cooking, add the chorizo to a skillet and brown it over medium heat, approx. 8-10 minutes.   Once browned set aside until you need it.

recipeInstructions.text: I use the leftover chorizo fat in the pan to soften up the finely diced 1/2 onion.  (You can get rid of some of the fat if you want.)  Once softened, add a minced garlic clove and briefly saute.
recipeInstructions.name: I use the leftover chorizo fat in the pan to soften up the finely diced 1/2 onion.  (You can get rid of some of the fat if you want.)  Once softened, add a minced garlic clove and briefly saute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the drained potatoes to the pan along with 4 minced chipotles in adobo, 1 tablespoon adobo sauce, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, freshly cracked black pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon pure chili powder (optional).  Keep in mind that you can use less chipotles for a milder batch.  I usually de-stem and de-seed the chipotles.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the drained potatoes to the pan along with 4 minced chipotles in adobo, 1 tablespoon adobo sauce, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, freshly cracked black pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon pure chili powder (optional).  Keep in mind that you can use less chipotles for a milder batch.  I usually de-stem and de-seed the chipotles.

recipeInstructions.text: Saute for a few minutes to ensure the potatoes are cooked through and then add the cooked chorizo.  Bring everything to a uniform temp and take a final taste for seasoning.  I added another generous pinch of salt to this batch.
recipeInstructions.name: Saute for a few minutes to ensure the potatoes are cooked through and then add the cooked chorizo.  Bring everything to a uniform temp and take a final taste for seasoning.  I added another generous pinch of salt to this batch.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the taquitos, start by warming up the corn tortillas.  I covered with them  damp paper towels and microwaved them for a minute or so.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the taquitos, start by warming up the corn tortillas.  I covered with them  damp paper towels and microwaved them for a minute or so.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2-3 tablespoons of the Potato-Chorizo mixture to each tortilla along with strips or cubes of cheese.  Roll tight and place them seam side down.  You can optionally use a toothpick to hold them together.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 2-3 tablespoons of the Potato-Chorizo mixture to each tortilla along with strips or cubes of cheese.  Roll tight and place them seam side down.  You can optionally use a toothpick to hold them together.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake the taquitos in a 400F oven for 20 minutes or so.  I usually start taking peeks after 15 minutes and take them out when the edges are turning darker brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake the taquitos in a 400F oven for 20 minutes or so.  I usually start taking peeks after 15 minutes and take them out when the edges are turning darker brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately with your choice of Salsa.  Or this Chipotle Mayo.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately with your choice of Salsa.  Or this Chipotle Mayo.

recipeInstructions.text: They store best uncooked.  Once rolled I put half of this batch in the freezer for an hour, then removed the toothpicks and stacked them in a Ziploc.  If baking straight from the freezer they might need a couple extra minutes but not much longer so keep an eye on them.  You could alternatively store them in the fridge where they will keep for a few days.
recipeInstructions.name: They store best uncooked.  Once rolled I put half of this batch in the freezer for an hour, then removed the toothpicks and stacked them in a Ziploc.  If baking straight from the freezer they might need a couple extra minutes but not much longer so keep an eye on them.  You could alternatively store them in the fridge where they will keep for a few days.
